page.title: 12INTERVIEW MRS.CAME
page.content: Rachel and Emma interviewed Mrs.Came who has lived in the area for many years.About 70 years ago she said that roads were much narrower and had no pavements.There were fewer houses,most of them being small cottages.Most of the work on the farm,where she lives,was done by machine.There were fewer shops and the local post office only sold sweets,now it sells groceries and plants.The shops were not of self service type and there were no supermarkets. The ladies wore long straight dresses, hats,gloves and silk stockings. The local school had only one room and there were not so many children. Not so many buses were running and so you either walked or travelled by horse and trap. By Rachel and Emma.
